section.name: Expression step
section.p: This step allow to compute expression using the filtered alignments and a annotation file that contains genomic elements to count. Eoulsan currently provide two counting methods : the original Eoulsan counting method and htseq-count. The second method is a fast the implementation of htseq-count. For more information about this method see HTSeq website.
WARNING: The support of the original Eoulsan counter is now deprecated and will be soon removed from Eoulsan.

ul.li: Available: Both local and distributed mode

Input port:
input: alignments in SAM format (format: mapper_results_sam)

Output port:
output: expression file in TSV format (format: expression_results_tsv)

tr.td: The name of the counter to use (eoulsanCounter or htseq-count). The support of eoulsanCounter will be soon removed from Eoulsan.
feature type (3rd column in GFF file) to be used, all features of other type are ignored.
GFF attribute to be used as feature ID

If "reverse", the read has to be mapped to the opposite strand as the feature. If "yes" or "no", the read has to be mapped to the same strand as the feature or it is considered overlapping with a feature regardless of whether it is mapped to the same or the opposite strand as the feature.
Name of the overlap mode to use (union, intersection-nonempty or intersection-strict).
Keep or remove ambiguous cases in the count.
Split values of the attribute field

section.p: In local mode, use the main.tmp.dir global parameter to set the temporary directory if this step fails with a full disk error.
Note:The htseq-count counter always filter multi-matches reads (using the NH tag of the optional fields of the SAM entries) before counting.
